question: How did the AMD Data Center segment perform in Q3 2024?
ground_truth: The Data Center segment revenue reached a record $3.5 billion in Q3 2024, up 122% year-over-year, driven by strong sales of AMD Instinct GPUs and EPYC CPUs.
generated_answer:
Atomic Facts with Citations:
• AMD Data Center GPU revenue was very strong in Q3 2024, with the company completing important customer milestones and ramping above initial expectations [C6]
• AMD raised full-year Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion based on completion of customer milestones [C6]
• Data Center GPU revenue in September was approximately $1.5 billion [C5]
• Data Center GPU business was approaching the size of AMD's compute business, which was around $1.7 billion [C7]
• AMD had a very strong quarter for the Data Center overall in Q3, especially for the Instinct product portfolio [C6]
 Final Answer:
AMD's Data Center segment delivered exceptional performance in Q3 2024, driven primarily by strong GPU revenue growth.
Data Center GPU Revenue: Approximately $1.5 billion in September [C5], approaching the size of AMD's compute business at ~$1.7 billion [C7]. The segment completed important customer milestones and ramped above initial expectations [C6].
Full-Year Guidance Raised: AMD increased Data Center GPU guidance from exceeding $4.5 billion to exceeding $5 billion, representing a $500 million upward revision based on customer milestone completions [C6].
Instinct Portfolio Strength: The Instinct product portfolio was particularly strong, contributing to the overall Data Center segment outperformance [C6].
Quarterly Performance: AMD characterized Q3 as "very strong" for both the overall Data Center segment and specifically the Instinct GPU business [C6].
Specific segment revenue breakdown, operating margins, and sequential growth rates: Not found in provided sources.
The strong Q3 performance positions AMD well for continued Data Center growth trajectory through year-end 2024.
